title: Sergio Santín
text:
Sergio Rodolfo Santín Spinelli (born August 6, 1956 in <a href="Salto%2C%20Uruguay">Salto</a>) is a retired <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> <a href="Striker%20%28association%20football%29">striker</a> from <a href="Uruguay">Uruguay</a>, who was <a href="nickname">nickname</a>d "Bocha" during his professional career.
Career.
Having made his official debut on July 18, 1980 against Peru (2-2), Santín obtained a total number of 18 international caps for the <a href="Uruguay%20national%20football%20team">Uruguay national football team</a>. He represented his native country at the <a href="1986%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">1986 FIFA World Cup</a>, wearing the number eleven jersey.
Santín played club football for <a href="Danubio%20F.C.">Danubio</a> and <a href="C.A.%20Pe%C3%B1arol">Peñarol</a> in Uruguay and <a href="Corporaci%C3%B3n%20Nuevo%20C%C3%BAcuta%20Deportivo">Cúcuta Deportivo</a>, <a href="Atletico%20Nacional">Atletico Nacional</a>, <a href="Independiente%20Medell%C3%ADn">Independiente Medellín</a> and <a href="Am%C3%A9rica%20de%20Cali">América de Cali</a> in <a href="Colombia">Colombia</a>
Santín currently works as <a href="Ricardo%20Gareca">Ricardo Gareca</a>'s assistant coach in <a href="Club%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20V%C3%A9lez%20S%C3%A1rsfield">Vélez Sársfield</a>'s <a href="coaching%20staff">coaching staff</a>.
